author: kongunui
title: I-AM-ROBOT!
review:
I got this set for Christmas and I thought it was a good set so far we have built:

Guard-bot

Tag-bot

Zippy-bot

Bumper-bot

Pros.
Variable robots.
Can build your own.

Cons.
Walking robots are hard to move.

Another pro.
Calling all bionicle fans, there are two pairs of visorak teeth!

Buy this set and you won't regret it.

author: saber755
title: pure mad scientist genious!
review:
if you ever wanted to be a mad scientist, this is your chance.
with 577 pieces and 569 of witch are basic technic elements this is a perfect bulk piece set.
of course thats not why i would by it but to each his own.
with 3 powerfull servo motors, 1 touch sensor, 1 light sensor, 1 sound sensor, 1 ultrasonic sensor and 1 intelegence brick, you good to go for any mad scientist expeiriment.
all of the things you can do is so fun that you can't even imagine it all untill you buy it.

pros:

many elements.
powerfull servo motors.
easy programing.
fairly scratch resistent.
easy to clean.
quickstart box.
and many models to build.

cons:

works better with non rechargeble batteries, so it's expencive to get the best proformance.
it comes with phone jack wires, that if not taken care of properly will brake easily.
and about $20-35 to steap of a price.
overall 4.5 out of 5.
sencerily saber755.
